title.narrative: Malaria Kits for Emergency WaSH & Nutrition Response

description.narrative:
South Sudan is experiencing a humanitarian crisis that peaked in the middle of 2016. More than 3 million have fled their homes since the beginning of the conflict in 2013. 2.9 million people remain severely food insecure, with a projected increase to 5.5 million people at the height of the lean season in July. Since 1985, Action Against Hunger has been operational in close collaboration with relevant government ministries, responding to both chronic and acute humanitarian needs. Malaria and undernutrition are the two major causes of childhood mortality in Sub-Saharan Africa. Each year, malaria kills more than 800,000 people, of whom 91% reside in Africa and 85% are children under five years old. Undernutrition is considered the underlying cause of more than 50% of all child deaths in this region, including those from malaria.
Based on the proposed level of funding, Action Against Hunger focuses this support on malaria testing and treatment for our nutrition beneficiaries. As malaria is one of the leading causes of morbidity for beneficiaries of our nutrition programs, this life-saving intervention is an essential component of our programs. The funding from Carluccio’s allows the organization to provide malaria testing for at least 15,400 children, who are particularly at risk for malaria when suffering from undernutrition, and vice versa.
